FuncDef:
The traffic-policy network inbound link-layer command applies a traffic policy in the VSI view.
The undo traffic-policy network inbound command cancels a traffic policy in the VSI view.
By default, no traffic policy is applied in the VSI view.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To apply a traffic policy to the upstream public-network-side traffic on the tunnel outbound interface to which a VSI is bound, run the traffic-policy policy-name network inbound link-layer command in the VSI view.
Precautions
The VSI ACL does not support redirection, URPF, forwarding action priority adjustment, syslog, sampling, or load balancing. If any of these actions is configured in a traffic behavior of a traffic policy, this traffic policy cannot be applied to the VSI instance view.
